a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Number of coral bleaching events by stage of the ENSO cycle
Coral bleaching typically occurs when water temperatures rise above the normal range for the coral's habitat. This
is more likely during El Ni√±o stages of the ENSO cycle when tropical sea temperatures are warmer.
Data source: Hughes, T. P., et al. (2018). Spatial and temporal patterns of mass bleaching of corals in the Anthropocene. Science.
